text: The coat of arms of Serbia was adopted on 17 August 2004. Blazon: The principal field stands for the Serbian State (Gules a double-headed eagle with wings displayed and inverted Argent, langued, beaked, legged and unguled Or, between two fleurs-de-lys of the third in base), while inescutcheon stands for Serbian Nation (Gules a cross Argent between four fire-steels of the same). Serbia Category:National symbols of Serbia
title: Coat of arms of Serbia
